column3: @practicalswift is this correct?\n\n@ryanofsky please take a look too.
utACK 712d35bc563ac7de0b7dfc3a35fc48dc6448fa6a. Would be nice if there was a (unit) test that run into problems with tsan.

utACK 712d35bc563ac7de0b7dfc3a35fc48dc6448fa6a

Good catch!

Could be similar issues in other constructors/destructors.

> ... race for g_dbenvs. This wasn't detected before because thread safety analysis does not check constructors and destructors.\n\nA solution to that would be to require that constructors don't access globals in their body. Calling a function that does it for them would be fine, since that is covered by the static analyser.
